LanguageData.Children_TabSchedule_Header: Schedule, current day of the year:
LanguageData.Children_TabSchedule_InfoDescription: If the timeslot from this table is active, the blackboard automatically manages its tasks, so that the current lesson gets tought. (! Current task will be removed automatically on this blackboard when in schedule-mode!)
LanguageData.Children_TabSchedule_ManualModeTable: manual mode, no student or schedule
LanguageData.Children_TabSchedule_AutoModeBillsDeacti: automatic schedule on blackboard active, bills can't be changed and are automatically managed and overridden
LanguageData.Children_TabSchedule_RoomInfo_Researchin: Benefits from techprints, a research-bench in the room and art/books related to research.
LanguageData.Children_TabSchedule_RoomInfo_Social: Benefits from the amount of learning people in the room, a comms-console in the room and art/books related to trade/social interactions.
LanguageData.Children_TabSchedule_RoomInfo_Melee: Benefits from melee weapons, security related things (sandbags, turrets, traps etc.) in the room and art/books related to melee fighting.
LanguageData.Children_TabSchedule_RoomInfo_Shooting: Benefits from ranged weapons, security related things (sandbags, turrets, traps etc.) in the room and art/books related to ranged fighting.
LanguageData.Children_TabSchedule_RoomInfo_Animals: Benefits from animals in the room and art/books related to animals.
LanguageData.Children_TabSchedule_RoomInfo_Artistic: Benefits from artistic items in the room and books related to art.
LanguageData.Children_TabSchedule_RoomInfo_Cooking: Benefits from cooked meals, a stove/brewery in the room and art/books related to cooking.
LanguageData.Children_TabSchedule_RoomInfo_Medicine: Benefits from medicine, corpses, patients, medical things/beds in the room and art/books related to medical work.
LanguageData.Children_TabSchedule_RoomInfo_Mining: Benefits from stone blocks, a stonecutter in the room and art/books related to mining.
LanguageData.Children_TabSchedule_RoomInfo_Constructi: Benefits from stone blocks, a stonecutter in the room and art/books related to construction.
LanguageData.Children_TabSchedule_RoomInfo_Tailoring: Benefits from tailored things, a tailoring-bench in the room and art/books related to tailoring.
LanguageData.Children_TabSchedule_RoomInfo_Crafting: Benefits from crafted things, mechanoid corpses, a stonecutter/smelter/smithy/machining-table/fabrication-bench in the room and art/books related to crafting.
LanguageData.Children_TabSchedule_RoomInfo_Growing: Benefits from plant-material, dryads, planters in the room and books related to botany.
LanguageData.Children_PreferedTeacher_HeaderTooltip: (optional teacher, is assigned to the job, if available. Order: Main teacher, substitute teacher, everyone with teaching)
LanguageData.Children_PreferedStudent_HeaderTooltip: (optional student, is assigned to the job, if available. Order: Main student, substitute student, everyone with learning !!This will result in the bills beeing managed automatically and manual settings are lost)
LanguageData.Children_PreferedStudent_MaxLevelLearnin: Only learn until reaching this level
LanguageData.Children_DisableChildren_Desc: Colonists should no longer be able to have children from this mod. (Does not remove existing children or pregnancies which can also be hidden. Needs a game restart for some parts to deactivate)
LanguageData.Children_DisableHandlingPregnancies_Desc: Use this option together with 'Disable children'(above) if you have another mod (or Biotech) that should take care of pregnancies and birth (Does not remove existing children or pregnancies, disables most of the options and functions related to pregnancies)
LanguageData.Children_DisableChildrenItems_Title: Disable children related properties and items
LanguageData.Children_DisableChildrenItems_Desc: Experimental! (also removes/hides fertility etc.) (May need a game restart for some parts to deactivate. May cause issues if removed from an active save)
LanguageData.Children_DisableSchoolItems_Desc: Experimental! (May need a game restart for some parts to deactivate. May cause issues if removed from an active save)
LanguageData.GeneratedChildrenLifeStage_Desc: Sets the lifestage at which alien children are born (instead of the normal age, because they can vary greatly between the races - uses the human-age(above) if no valid age can be found)
LanguageData.Children_GeneratedChildrenLearnMinAge_De: Minimum age to learn at school
LanguageData.Children_GeneratedChildrenLearnMinAgeAnd: Minimum age to learn at school for androids, droids and holograms
LanguageData.Children_GeneratedChildrenLearnMaxAge_De: Maximum age to learn at school
LanguageData.Children_UseLifeStagesAsUpperLearningLim: Use the lifestage age for the 'Learn max. age' instead, defined in the per species settings below. (Without fitting per species setting, the value above is still used.)
LanguageData.Children_AlternateSchoolDayCountEnabled_: [Needs reload!]Count school days in a continuous 1-4 loop, not every odd/even/third/fourth day of the year. (in this mode, days are skipped if they are not active)
LanguageData.Children_DynamicTeacherSchoolAreaFromBla: Assign school area for scheduled Teacher
Dynamically switch a teacher into the school-area, if they have a scheduled active lesson.
LanguageData.Children_StudentLearningXPMultiplier_Des: This can be used to change the impact the students intellectual skill has on XP gained while learning
LanguageData.Children_TeacherLearningXPMultiplier_Des: This can be used to change the impact the teacher has on XP gained while learning
LanguageData.Children_RoomLearningXPMultiplier_Desc: This can be used to change the impact the room has on XP gained while learning
LanguageData.Children_TotalLearningNeolithicXPMultipl: This can be used to change the final XP value for teaching/learning spots (in addition to the previous settings)
LanguageData.Children_TotalLearningXPMultiplier_Desc: This can be used to change the final XP value (in addition to the previous settings)
LanguageData.Children_TotalLearningNonAdultXPMultipli: This can be used to change the final XP value for all colonists that are not in the 'adult' lifestage (in addition to the previous settings)
LanguageData.Children_StudentLearningNeedSatisfyMulti: How much the learning need of a child get satisfied through CSL-lessons. (0=Off) (This takes the room multiplier from CSL and if the lesson-desire is present into account)
LanguageData.Children_PregnancyDuration_Desc: 0 - 1000% (Standard human pawn: 100% = 45 days) [Rimworld needs to restart for this to affect the game!]
LanguageData.Children_ReverseFertilityEnabled_Desc: [Needs reload!]Disables fertility for all colonists on default - the drug 'fertility booster' or the medical operation is needed to be able to get pregnant (not for animals)
LanguageData.Children_AddFertilityStatEnabled_Desc: Considers the fertility-value from CSL or BirdsAndBees in calculations, even if CSL does not handle pregnancies! Also the other way around for CSL calculations!
LanguageData.Children_AlwaysShowPregnancyEnabled_Desc: Normally the base game has the first third of the pregnancy duration hidden, this disables it for colonists (not for animals)
LanguageData.Children_SendPregnancyMessageCSLEnabled_: Instead of the 600 ticks message from RW1.3
LanguageData.Children_GetReproductionFromLifeStageEna: Sets the fertility to 0 if pawn is not reproductive in current life stage
LanguageData.Children_GetReproductionFromOldAgeEnable: Sets the fertility to 0 in 3 steps if pawn is of old age. (Disabled with BirdsAndBees) (('life expectancy' - 'age to be in last lifestage') / 5, 2/5=100%, 3/5=80%, 4/5=50%, 5/5=0%)
LanguageData.Children_AlwaysHaveChildren_Desc: All factors are ignored and lovin always results in pregnancy (mostly for testing/mod compatibility checking)
LanguageData.Children_IgnoreGender_Desc: Disables the check for female gender for a pregnancy to occur. (including the medical operation)
LanguageData.Children_IgnoreGenderInOperation_Desc: Disables the check for female gender for a pregnancy to occur in the medical operation
LanguageData.Children_InvertGender_Desc: Inverts CSL gender checks: female=male, male=female
LanguageData.Children_TakeOverSafeJWPregnancy_Desc: When a pregnancy chance would occur let CSL take over instead
LanguageData.Children_VanillaExpandedMemesPregnancyCh: Orgy: Chances are generated for colonists that were present for at least 30% of the ritual and have neutral/positive opinions of each other (-4 and better) with a positive result with default options
LanguageData.Children_VanillaExpandedMemesPregnancyFi: Orgy: Chances are only generated with a positive ritual result
Orgy: Chances are only generated for non blood related colonists
Orgy: Chances are only generated for colonists that have a neutral/positive opinion of each other (-4 and better)
LanguageData.Children_MixedSpeciesChildrenAllowed_Des: Can mixed species couples have children? When on there is a 50/50 chance what species the child is
LanguageData.Children_ShowPartnerDialogWithOperationE: The partner for the 'artificially impregnate'-operation can be selected when the operation is successful and glitter-medicine is used.
LanguageData.Children_AlwaysShowPartnerDialogWithOper: Always show partner dialog on operation
The partner for the 'artificially impregnate'-operation can always be selected when the operation is successful.
LanguageData.Children_ShowChildSpeciesDialogIfUnclear: Show child species dialog if unclear
Sometimes the species of the parents can not be determined to 100%, show a dialog to choose it when it happens.
LanguageData.Children_AlwaysShowChildSpeciesDialogEna: Always show a dialog to choose the child species on birth.
LanguageData.Children_AndroidChildrenAllowed_Desc: [Needs reload!]Can androids/personae have children? (Needs reload to take full effect!)
LanguageData.Children_DroidChildrenAllowed_Desc: [Needs reload!]Can droids/robots/mechanents have children? (Needs reload to take full effect!)
LanguageData.Children_HologramChildrenAllowed_Desc: [Needs reload!]Can Holograms(SoS2) have children? (Needs reload to take full effect!)
LanguageData.Children_AutomatonChildrenAllowed_Desc: [Needs game restart!]Can Automaton(Paniel) have children? (Needs reload to take full effect!)
LanguageData.Children_AvaliChildrenAllowed_Desc: Can be used to disable the Mod-Routine for Avali
LanguageData.Children_VampireChildrenAllowed_Desc: Can Vampires have children? (Rim of Madness)
LanguageData.Children_VampireChildrenAreVampires_Desc: Are children of vampires also vampires? (Rim of Madness)
LanguageData.Children_WerewolfChildrenAreWerewolfs_De: Are children of werewolfs also werewolfs? (Rim of Madness)
LanguageData.Children_WerewolfChildrenMinAgeFirstTran: At what age do werewolf children first transform? (Rim of Madness)
LanguageData.Children_WerewolfChildrenPregnancyDurati: 0 - 100% of normal duration (100% = no difference to normal) (Rim of Madness)
LanguageData.Children_PostpartumEnabled_Desc: Adds a debuff to fertility over a period of 50 days in 3 Stages (-100%,-80%,-50%)
LanguageData.Children_NoMiscarriageEnabled_Desc: Disables the possibility of a miscarriage(from the base-game) for human/humanlike colonists
LanguageData.Children_NoStillbornEnabled_Desc: Disables the possibility of a stillborn child(from biotech) for human/humanlike colonists
LanguageData.Children_AlwaysShowMiscarriageEnabled_De: Shows the miscarriage-message(from the base-game) even if the pregnancy was not visible yet.
LanguageData.Children_AddLactatingToRealMotherEnabled: If the birthing mother is different from the biological one.
LanguageData.Children_RetryOnBirthIssueEnabled_Desc: Try to restore the pregnancy if the mod could detect that a birth has not happened when it should have.
LanguageData.Children_RetryOnBirthIssueEnabled_Messag: Should the pregnancy of {0} be restored? (No born children could be found!) (This dialog can be disabled in the options.)
LanguageData.Children_VFEConflict_Message: Scaling for children is activated ('Enable scaling') and the mod 'Vanilla Expanded Framework' is active with 'Disable Texture Caching' checked, these options are not compatible and there is no easy way to resolve this for now, please go into the 'Vanilla Expanded Framework'-Settings and uncheck it (so it has a red X). (This dialog will not be shown again until mod-settings are reset)
LanguageData.Children_PostponeBirthOnMIssionEnabled_D: If close to birth, wait until the colonist comes back, if the colonist is on a non player controlled mission. (These are normally shuttle missions 'lending' someone away) (A birth outside of player control can cause weird behaviour) (Birth do still happen on caravans)
LanguageData.Children_TryFixHumanKindEnabled_Desc: Try to fix issues with variants of human(kindDefs) that may cause issues on birth. (This does not change other species to humans, it just makes sure that humans are all the same base-type)
LanguageData.Children_TryFixSpecialKindEnabled_Title: Set Special humans to base type
LanguageData.Children_TryFixSpecialKindEnabled_Desc: Try to fix issues with the AncientSoldier and StrangerInBlack variants of human(kindDefs) that may cause issues on birth. (This should already be fixed with the above option aswell)
LanguageData.Children_OneChildEnabled_Desc: Limits fertility after birth, so that everyone has only one pregnancy. (This can be removed through an operation. Needs a game restart!)
LanguageData.Children_OneChildMultiplier_Desc: 100 means fertility is deactivated after one child (like it was in the past), smaller values get added after each birth and also reduce fertiltiy until 100 is reached
LanguageData.Children_PartnerMissingMoodDebuffEnabled: If the partner is not on the same map as the pregnant colonist a mood debuff occurs at the time the pregnancy becomes known, this vanishes, should the partner return or the time runs out. (can take a short ingame time to vanish if disabled)
LanguageData.Children_PartnerNoLongerTogetherMoodDebu: If the partner and the pregnant colonist are no longer in a realtionship a mood debuff occurs at the time the pregnancy becomes known, this vanishes, should they get back together or the time runs out. (can take a short ingame time to vanish if disabled)
LanguageData.Children_MultiLVBedEnabled_Desc: Add support for beds with more than two sleeping spots like the mod:'Polyamory Beds' with the new 1.3 support of multiple spouses, partners can join.
LanguageData.Children_MultiLVBedOnlyNegativeShareBedO: Prevent negative bed-share mood for partners
Only allows partners in bed to have the negative mood:'shared bed with someone' if they have an actual negative opinion when both are partners of someone in the same bed.
LanguageData.Children_MultiLVJoinChanceBoostIfSameSpo: (Multiplier x)If sharing at least one partner already. Base chance depends on opinion and normal chances for lovers (0=Off, 1.0=Neutral)
LanguageData.Children_MultiLVBoostLoversGenChance_Tit: Influence chances to gen. new lovers
LanguageData.Children_MultiLVBoostLoversGenChance_Des: (Multiplier x)Influence chances to generate lovers between spouses that are not already (depends also on opinion and normal chances for lovers) (0=Off, 1.0=Neutral)
LanguageData.Children_MultiLVJoinOnlyLoversOrSpouseEn: Only join when all partners are lovers or spouses (is checked after lover generation)
LanguageData.Children_MultiLVWakeUpOnFailChance_Title: Chance to wake up on failure %
LanguageData.Children_MultiLVWakeUpOnFailChance_Desc: Chance to wake up if the colonists did not join, chance in % (0=Off)
LanguageData.Children_MultiLVCheatedOnFailChance_Desc: Add 'X cheated on me'-mood if the colonists did not join, chance in %, must view at least one partner negative(-30 or worse opinion) (0=Off)
LanguageData.Children_ShowSpeciesEnabled_Desc: Show the expected species of the child in health-tab
LanguageData.Children_ShowDurationEnabled_Desc: Show duration until birth in health-tab
LanguageData.Children_DebugTickDisabled_Desc: There might be a Problem with the base chances in the game, this is why this mods boosts them
LanguageData.Children_RandomBackstoryEnabled_Desc: Chooses one of the base-game backstories that are mostly ok, instead of 'child of the colony'
LanguageData.Children_TribeChildBackstoryForColonyEna: Enable 'Tribe Child' backstory for colony children
use 'tribe child' instead of 'child of the colony'
LanguageData.Children_CSLChildBackstoryForColonyEnabl: Use CSL child backstories for colony children (Biotech)
If Biotech is active this option can be used to still use the CSL backstories for children, otherwise the backstories for children from Biotech are used.
LanguageData.Children_ColonyChildNaturalFocusEnabled_: [Needs reload!]Born colonists with the 'child of the colony' backstory also get a natural meditation focus (like tribal colonists) (Can be changed at will and affects existing colonists, but needs reload, save and reload again after changing the option to take full effect!)
LanguageData.GeneratedChildrenInheritPercentage_Desc: Percentage of parents skills inherited (0=All skills level 1) ((Parent1 + Parent2 skilllevel / 2) * Percentage) (Random=Normal skill generation)
LanguageData.GeneratedChildrenInheritTraits_Desc: Defines which/how traits get generated for children
LanguageData.GeneratedChildrenInheritTraitCount_Desc: How many traits are inherited from parents, when 'inherit traits' is active ('Max traits' will remove some of those when over the limit)
LanguageData.GeneratedChildrenTraitMax_Desc: Defines how many traits children can have at maximum (removes traits at random after generation until set max. is met)
LanguageData.GeneratedChildrenTraitScenario_Desc: The other trait-settings might prevent/override the scenario traits + New pawns don't normally consider the starting traits from a scenario which this setting can re-enable
LanguageData.GeneratedChildrenLastName_Desc: Defines who's last name children get
LanguageData.GeneratedChildrenGender_Desc: Gives the option to override the gender at birth to fix rare issues. (This may in turn be overridden by other mods or species or cause problems with them [use the per species settings at the bottom to try to fix AlienRaces etc.])
LanguageData.GeneratedChildrenColorMixing_Desc: This defines how the hair, body colors (and other, for some 'AlienRaces') are calculated on birth.
LanguageData.Children_PrioritizeTraitIfBothParents_De: Traits that both parents possess are inherited first (trait inherit settings and limits still apply! These trait just gets added first - it might additionally makes sense to take a look at mods that allow for more traits)
LanguageData.Children_TryToAddForcedPassions_Desc: In normal generation traits are only added with fitting forced passions, if they have any. Tries to add them after the fact.
LanguageData.Children_TryFixZeroPassions_Desc: In some cases children can have 0 passions.
LanguageData.Children_TryAddVSEPassions_Desc: Tries to add VanillaSkillsExpanded passions on birth.
LanguageData.Children_FixLifestageMinAgeEnabled_Desc: Try to correct the minAge given by the adult lifestage (this is mostly related to growth and the basegame has issues with large values)
LanguageData.Children_TryFixGrowthSmallerThanShouldBe: (Age changed to be older)With 1.3 there seems to be issues where colonists change their age to fast and the life-stage is no longer correct which can result in all kiiinds of issues.
LanguageData.Children_TryFixGrowthLargerThanShouldBeE: (Age changed to be younger)With 1.3 there seems to be issues where colonists change their age to fast and the life-stage is no longer correct which can result in all kiiinds of issues.
LanguageData.Children_TryFixGrowthAgressiveEnabled_De: This will try even more fixes (on savegame load only, works only in addition two the options above!!)
LanguageData.Children_InheritIdeologyFromParent_Desc: Try to set the ideology of the child to one of the mother or father (random 50/50). (Does not work with Biotech and newborn children, only older ones).
LanguageData.Children_FixedAdultDevelopmentStageNonBi: Otherwise young children still have some of the Biotech properties even without Biotech active.
LanguageData.Children_FixMovementZeroNonBiotechEnable: Otherwise young children can't move or eat etc.
LanguageData.Children_DisableSchoolZoneChanges_Desc: Don't change the area to school automatically (might prevent some issues with other mods)
LanguageData.Children_DisableChangingBlackboardGraphi: Don't show the changing blackboard graphics for active lessons
LanguageData.Children_DisableChangingSchoolTableGraph: Don't show the changing student-desk graphics for active lessons
LanguageData.Children_HideNotAssignTeachOrStudyInMenu: Hide colonists who can't study/teach on school-desk/blackboard menus
LanguageData.SchoolsOutMinFireDanger_Desc: Defines which fire danger triggers that the school-area is no longer respected in school-time.
LanguageData.Children_RoomNotClassroom: This room is not considered to be a classroom and will not recieve any learning bonus!
LanguageData.Children_TeacherNotTeaching: Teacher not teaching or teaching other subject
LanguageData.Children_SpotNoLesson: No active lesson on teaching spot!
LanguageData.Children_BlackboardNoLessonLearn: No active lesson on blackboard or no blackboard is connected!
LanguageData.Children_SpotNoLessonLearn: No active lesson on teaching spot or no teaching spot is connected!
LanguageData.ChildrenMessageBirthGuestStatus: The faction/status of {0} could not be set, because there were no matching free beds.
LanguageData.ChildrenMessageMedicalOperationPregFailu: {1} could not get artificially pregnant, reason: {0}
{1} can not get artificially pregnant because he is male
{1} has no fertility and can not get artificially pregnant
LanguageData.ChildrenMessageMedicalOperationPregSucce: {1} is now artificially pregnant without a partner
LanguageData.ChildrenMessageMedicalOperationRemovePre: {1} was not pregnant (the operation had no effect)
The pregnancy of {1} was successfully aborted through the operation
LanguageData.ChildrenMessageMedicalOperationRemoveOne: {1} did not have the 'one pregnancy only' debuff (the operation had no effect)
The 'one pregnancy only' debuff of {1} was successfully removed through the operation
LanguageData.ChildrenMessageNotLearningMuch: {1} can't learn much from {0} anymore (Message can be disabled)
LanguageData.ChildrenMessageOldEnoughToWork: {1} is now old enough to work
LanguageData.Children_PawnSizeEnabled_Desc: [May need reload!]Younger colonists are drawn smaller, based on their lifestage.
LanguageData.Children_UVPawnSizeModeEnabled_Desc: [Experimental][May need reload!]Try to scale UVs instead of camera zoom. (May work better with some mods)
LanguageData.Children_PortraitSizeEnabled_Desc: [May need reload!]Younger colonists are drawn smaller on portraits aswell.
LanguageData.Children_SizeWithBiotechEnabled_Title: Enable scaling even with Biotech active
LanguageData.Children_AdjustHARSizeFactorEnabled_Desc: [HumanoidAlienRaces][Only valid without Biotech](tries to fix slightly too large ears etc. can also be further adjusted in per species settings)
LanguageData.Children_NewPawnSizeModeEnabled_Desc: A better way of scaling that should be more compatible with other mods
LanguageData.Children_FacialStuffSizeModeEnabled_Desc: Enable FacialStuff scaling with the new scaling-mode (test)
LanguageData.Children_NoWorkYoungEnabled_Desc: [Needs reload!]Young colonists are not able to perform tasks (humans 0-3 / once they are 4 years they can work). (Is not active together with Biotech). NEEDS RELOAD!
LanguageData.Children_NoAddictionUntilAge_Desc: [Needs reload!]Until the set age is reached possible addictions are subdued (This does not prevent them taking drugs, it just subdues the need to take them if they are born with an addiction). NEEDS RELOAD!
LanguageData.Children_NoAddictionUntilAge_MessageOldE: {0} is now old enough that possible addictions are no longer subdued.
LanguageData.Children_NotLearningMessageEnabled_Desc: Display the message: 'X can't learn much from Y anymore'
LanguageData.Children_AlwaysRenameFirstNameEnabled_De: Enables you to rename any colonists first name but overrides the normal nickname and title dialog (should be disabled after renaming, and is mostly for migrating from an old version without this function)
LanguageData.Children_DisableAnimalFilter_Desc: allows some of the settings like PerSpeciesSettings / HybridSettings / birth to be set for animals
LanguageData.Children_DisableAnimalSpeciesOperationFi: and the birth species-dialog (show more options than the species itself)
LanguageData.Children_RemoveMod_Desc: Opens a dialog to remove most of the mods content from the game. (Must be clicked in a running game)
LanguageData.Children_RemoveModMessage: This will try to remove most parts of the mod from this game. After it finishes you should save the game first without doing anything else and after that remove the mod from the load-order and reload the save. (There will be some error messages on the first reload (possibly also on the first save), but those shouldn't be a big problem)
LanguageData.Children_RemoveModCompeted: Most mod related parts should now be removed, save the game before doing anything else.
LanguageData.Children_DisableChildrenItemsMessage: This will also disable all child related functions of this mod! It is recommended to close and re-open the game after changing this! Items and properties of this mod may not be able to restored when loading a save with this setting! (There may also be some errors when first loading a save that had those items)
LanguageData.Children_DisableItemsMessage: It is recommended to close and re-open the game after changing this! Items and properties of this mod may not be able to restored when loading a save with this setting! (There may also be some errors when first loading a save that had those items)
LanguageData.Children_FixBrokenMap_Desc: Tries to fix a map that can no longer be loaded because the mod was not properly removed (will reset all areas of that map to default settings - mod still needs to be removed properly afterwards!)
LanguageData.Children_SchoolScheduleButtonX_Desc: This can be used to move the school-schedule button horizontally (To fix possible overlap with other mods etc.)
LanguageData.Children_SchoolScheduleButtonY_Desc: This can be used to move the school-schedule button vertically (To fix possible overlap with other mods etc.)
LanguageData.ChildrenMessageWorkTooYoungAge: Info: Will be old enough with:
LanguageData.ChildrenMessageWorkOldEnough: Info: Is now old enough (Save and reload if this persists)
LanguageData.ChildrenMessageChooseSpecies: Choose the species for the children of {0}
LanguageData.ChildrenMessageChooseSpeciesInfo: (This dialog is beeing shown, because the species could not be determined to 100%)
LanguageData.ChildrenMessageChooseSpeciesInfoNoFound: (This dialog is beeing shown, because there was no allowed species found)
LanguageData.ChildrenMessageChoosePartner: Choose the partner for the operation of {0}
LanguageData.Children_DesignatorAreaSchoolExpandDesc: Colonists who have school-time assigned will be locked inside this area for that time.
LanguageData.Children_PerSpeciesSettings_InfoDescript: These settings override the above settings based on the species of the child or parent(depending on the setting).
LanguageData.Children_PerSpeciesSettings_TableColumnH: Allow pregnancies for this species. (mother species) (Does not remove existing children or pregnancies which can also be hidden)
LanguageData.Children_PerSpeciesSettings_TableColumnM: Allow pregnancies from mixed species couples for this species. This option overrides the general 'mixed' option above! (parent species) (Does not remove existing children or pregnancies which can also be hidden)
LanguageData.Children_PerSpeciesSettings_TableColumnB: Allow this species to be born. If a pregnancy is from mixed species the other species is choosen or might show a dialog-box if no species can be determined because of this option. (child species) (The option "Show Species" above can be used to see if this option is active on a pregnancy, it will say 'restricted')
LanguageData.Children_PerSpeciesSettings_TableColumnD: [!!not imported!!] Should Biotech DevStages be forbidden? (Only with Biotech) (Turning this on can prevent issues with some non-human species, if they are born younger but cause issues with normal humans etc.)
LanguageData.Children_PerSpeciesSettings_TableColumnB: Option like main option above, just per species. (child species) (0-5000 years, default: setting from above)
LanguageData.Children_PerSpeciesSettings_TableColumnL: Younger then this lifestage age for the 'Learn max. age' in school instead.
LanguageData.Children_PerSpeciesSettings_TableColumnP: Option like main option above, just per species. (mother species) (0-1000%, default: setting from above) [Rimworld needs to restart for this to affect the game!]
LanguageData.Children_PerSpeciesSettings_TableColumnC: Multiplier for the number of children beeing born (child species) (greater 1.0 = more, smaller than 1.0 = less, capped: without multiplier 6, with multiplier 20)
LanguageData.Children_PerSpeciesSettings_TableColumnA: Additionally add this trait at birth first. (child species)
LanguageData.Children_PerSpeciesSettings_TableColumnD: Disable draw size scaling of children for this species. (child species)
Correct the base-size-factor of children for this species. This can fix to large or small children. (child species)
Some species may need different draw sizes (child species) (greater 1.0 = bigger, less than 1.0 = smaller)
[No longer relevant with 1.3]Some species may need different draw sizes for parts of them (child species) (greater 1.0 = bigger, less than 1.0 = smaller)
LanguageData.Children_SpeciesHybridSettings_InfoDescr: Define possible hybrid species, like: half elves from elves and humans (or elves and any species..). There can be multiple entries for the same species (The first match is used, so with multiple entries for the same hybrid - a possible 'Any species' entry should be last in the list). The option "Show Species" above can be used to see if this option is active on a pregnancy. There are some entries in here by default for the mods: 'Orassans' and 'Lord of the Rims: Elves' which are only usable with those mods enabled.
LanguageData.Children_HediffInheritSettings_InfoDescr: Define if and how certain health-conditions are inherited. The base-game does add random conditions, which are not altered unless they appear in this list.
LanguageData.Children_HediffInheritSettings_TableColu: Inherit this from the mother. (If both parents are selected, chances are doubled)
Inherit this from the father. (If both parents are selected, chances are doubled)
Off=First stage, On=Try to use the stage of the parents.

0-100% (0%=Off, remove this condition on birth regardless of parent) (Random mode: If the child has this randomly on birth and the parent has it aswell it stays - this is how addictions always worked and more of a legacy option for 'All addictions')
